alert.note: Alert for Davie (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 28 at 9:03PM EDT until August 28 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of piedmont North Carolina, including the following counties, Davie and Rowan. * WHEN...Until 300 AM EDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood- prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 859 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated 1-2 inches of rain has fallen across northwestern Rowan County, with heavy rainfall slowly moving into extreme southern Davie County. This rainfall will cause significant rises on small streams, especially feeding into the S Yadkin River north of Cleveland, with some streams exceeding bankfull. - Additional rainfall of 1-2 inches is possible over the next 60-90 minutes. A Flash Flood Warning may be needed if ongoing storms do not dissipate quickly enough Please stay weather aware and be prepared to seek higher ground if you are in an area vulnerable to flooding. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Cooleemee, Cleveland and Woodleaf. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
